intro: Chrysothamnus nauseosus subsp. bigelovii, commonly known as Bigelow's goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves and produces numerous small seeds that are dispersed by the wind. This subspecies is often found in foothill and mountainous regions, where it thrives in full sun.
